column4: since upgrading to maverick, i notice that mplayer no longer shows up in my menu. i have mplayer, mplayer-nogui and mplayer-skins installed... should mplayer not therefore be in the menu?
type which mplayer at the terminal
'/usr/bin/mplayer'
make a launcher on your desktop called Mplayer and enter /usr/bin/mplayer
if you type mplayer in the terninal it will run the program
i think what aeon-ltd is referring to is my issue. gmplayer has possibly been removed... checking that out right now
type which gmplayer at the terminal
i already know that it isn't installed... just want to see whether or not it has been removed from the repos
read this http://software.itags.org/linux-unix/605059/
gmplayer is just a symbolic link to mplayer
ok, then i am back to my original question....
so now you know gmplayer is just a symbolic link to mplayer
wise man
are you playing a DVD throuugh mplayer or just a regulat .avi .mpg .wmv type file ?
.avi's, .mpg's, .flv's
Use vlc player
i have switched to vlc for the time being... although vlc is unable to play audio on a fair percentage of .flv's
do you know how to build vlc from source ?
i know how to build from source, have never done vlc, however
building vlc from source might be a little challenging for you if your not familiar with how to obtain development libraries
does building vlc from source require dev libs that are not in the repos?
the development libraries are in the repos I had a problem with vlc earlier this week and had to upgrade ffmpeg and build vlc from source
so you compiled ffmpeg before you started as well then?
